description: The first "boring number", a positive number with the least number of classifications (4).
details: Ah, well... make that 5 now, since it’s also classified as a boring number!

description: Appears as the result of the classic three-digit reversal procedure: reverse, subtract, reverse, add.
details: Details: Start with 532 as example. Reverse: 235, Subtract: 532-235=297, Reverse: 792, Add: 297+792=1089.
Repeatedly subtract any number formed by its digits in ascending order from that in descending order. This process converges to the Kaprekar constant 495.
Repeatedly subtract any number formed by its digits in ascending order from that in descending order. This process converges to the Kaprekar constant 6174

description: An integer that is divisible by the sum of its digits in every base ≥ 2.
details: Only 1, 2, 4, and 6 are Harshad in every base ≥2.

description: Belphegor’s Prime: 666 with 13 zeros on either side.
